thread.title: Britain's youngest EuroMillions winner who moaned jackpot 'ruined her life' in court for drink driving charge
thread.title_full: Britain's youngest EuroMillions winner who moaned jackpot 'ruined her life' in court for drink driving charge

author: Lucy Clarke-Billings
title: Britain's youngest EuroMillions winner who moaned jackpot 'ruined her life' in court for drink driving charge
text:
News Britain's youngest EuroMillions winner who moaned jackpot 'ruined her life' in court for drink driving charge Jane Park, who was just 17 when she scooped £1million with her first-ever ticket, has appeared in court just days after a booze binge in Tenerife Share A trial date for the alleged offence has been set for next month (Photo: Daily Record) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Britain's youngest EuroMillions winner, who has claimed her ­stupendous windfall ­ruined her life, has appeared in court to face a drink driving charge – just days after a booze binge in Tenerife. 
Jane Park, 21, was allegedly three times the legal limit when she drove her BMW 1 Series through a McDonald’s drive-thru in Edinburgh in October last year. 
She appeared at Edinburgh Sheriff Court today under her mum’s name of Restorick, where she maintained a plea of not guilty , the Sun reports. 
Park recently missed a flight home from Tenerife after a wild night out. 
The 21-year-old was stranded on the Spanish island after getting "melted" celebrating her beloved football team Hibernian's win over Hearts in the Edinburgh derby. 
The Scot streamed the match on Periscope while on last-minute mini-break with a pal. 
She tweeted the next day: "Went out n got melted n missed my flight Hahahahahhaha mon eh hibs." Jane left Edinburgh Sheriff Court today in a black duffer coat and dark glasses (Photo: Daily Record) She previously said she would sue Camelot for ruining her life with the big win (Photo: Daily Record) 
The Lotto winner is accused of driving her car in Straiton Mains Road in the city on October 8 last year with an alcohol breath reading of 66 microgrammes, when the limit is 22. 
The Sun reports that the former admin worker’s solicitor Stephen Mannifield, told Sheriff Michael O’Grady QC, that his client denied the charge. 
Earlier this month, Park bizarrely threatened to sue Camelot, which runs the lottery in the UK, claiming she was too young to handle such riches. 
A trial date for the drink driving charge has been set for March 8. Like us on Facebook
